block.p: Women are often portrayed as shopaholics, but on Nordstrom's board, it is the men who appear to be dropping the most money while shopping.

The retailer offers its directors a 33 percent discount on all merchandise. According to the retailer's 2007 proxy statement, which discloses all pay and perks, the biggest spenders were men, led by the president, Blake W. Nordstrom, who received a break of $92,585. The company's lead outside director, Enrique Hernandez Jr., received discounts of $24,677.
